source_sentence: 大正句王經卷上
translation: Dazheng juewang jing shou

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試光祿卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra, Chaozan Dashi, and Guangluqing

source_sentence: 明教大師臣法賢奉　詔譯
translation: Mingjiao dashi ministers, Faxian, in accordance with the imperial edict, translated

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，尊者童子迦葉在憍薩羅國遊行，次第至於尸利沙大城之北，尸利沙林鹿野園中止住。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Venerable Kāśyapa the Younger marched through the country of Kauśālā and stopped in the Deer Preserve of the Śirīṣa Forest, north of the large city of Śirīṣa, one after the other.

source_sentence: 是時有王名大正句，都尸利沙城。
translation: At the time, there was a king named Taishengju who was based in the city of Śirīṣa.

source_sentence: 其王先來不信因果，每作是言：「無有來世，亦無有人，復無化生。」
translation: Previously, that king hadn't believed in the law of cause and effect and had said this every time, "There's no future life, no person, and no birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 常起如是斷見。
translation: He always formed this kind of cessationist view.

source_sentence: 爾時，尸利沙大城中有大婆羅門及長者主等，互相謂曰：「云何此沙門童子迦葉，來至此城之北尸利沙林鹿野園中？」
translation: At the time, there was a great brāhmaṇa and a lord of elders in the great city of Śirīṣa who said to each other, "How did this ascetic boy Kāśyapa come to be in the Deer Preserve of the Śirīṣa Forest to the north of this city?"

source_sentence: 是時尊者迦葉於彼城中名稱普聞，而彼城中一切人民，素聞迦葉善說法要，常說種種深妙之義，已得無病常行頭陀，是即應供是大阿羅漢。
translation: Venerable Kāśyapa's name was widely heard in that city, and all the people there had heard that Kāśyapa well taught the essentials of the Dharma, always explained various profound and subtle meanings, and had attained the status of leader of the constant practice without illness, which means he should be offered as a great arhat.

source_sentence: 今既來此，我等宜共往詣彼林禮覲供養。
translation: Now that we've come here, we should all go to that forest to pay our respects and make offerings.

source_sentence: 於是城中大婆羅門及長者等，咸出城北往詣尸利沙林鹿野園中，欲伸參問。
translation: Thereupon, the great brāhmaṇas and elders of the city all left the city to the north and went to the Deer Preserve in the Śrīṣa Grove, intending to ask questions.

source_sentence: 爾時，大正句王在高樓上，遙見城中婆羅門長者等同共出城，行詣城北往尸利沙林鹿野園中。
translation: It was then that the king of the Tathāgatas was on a high building and saw a group of brāhmaṇas and elders leave the city and go north to the Ṛṣipatana grove.

source_sentence: 王既見已問侍臣曰：「云何城中婆羅門長者同共出城，詣尸利沙林鹿野園中？」
translation: After he saw them, the king asked his attendants, "How did the Brāhmaṇa elders in the city leave the city together and go to the Deer Preserve of the Śrīsaprince?"

source_sentence: 侍臣白王：「有一沙門名童子迦葉，遊化至此大城之北尸利沙林鹿野園中而為止住。
translation: The attendants told the king, "There was an ascetic named Kāśyapa who traveled to the north of this large city to stay at Deer Park in the Śrīṣa Forest.

source_sentence: 是故城中諸婆羅門及長者等，同共出城禮覲供養。」
translation: That's why all the brāhmaṇas and elders in the city have gone out together to pay their respects and make offerings."

source_sentence: 王聞所奏即謂侍臣：「汝可往彼宣告彼眾婆羅門及長者等，汝宜且止須臾小待，我今速至當與汝等同共往彼，禮覲沙門童子迦葉。
translation: When the king heard what he had heard, he told his attendant, "You may go there and announce to those brāhmaṇas and elders that you should stop for a moment and wait, for I'll come quickly now and go with you to pay homage to the ascetic Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如我意者，或恐汝等婆羅門長者，為彼沙門童子迦葉邪法引導，不依智識妄稱有人及有他世，復有化生。」
translation: According to my intention, perhaps you elders of the brāhmaṇas might be led by the mistaken teaching of that ascetic Kāśyapa, who doesn't rely on knowledge and consciousness to falsely claim that there are human beings, other worlds, and birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 時彼侍臣受王勅已，往婆羅門長者處宣示王勅，謂彼眾言：「正句大王宣告：『汝等且止須臾，我當速至與汝同往，禮覲沙門童子迦葉。』」
translation: After receiving the king's order, his attendants went to the elder Brāhmaṇa and delivered the king's order, saying to the crowd, "The king correctly declared, 'Stop a moment, for I will quickly arrive with you and pay homage to the ascetic Kāśyapa.'"

source_sentence: 人眾受勅不敢前進。
translation: The crowd obeyed the command and didn't dare to go forward.

source_sentence: 爾時，侍臣傳王命已，復還王處而上奏言：「臣適奉命往婆羅門長者眾處具傳聖旨，令婆羅門與長者等且止須臾，王今速至，當與汝等同禮沙門童子迦葉。
translation: After the minister delivered the king's order, he returned to the king and reported, "I was instructed to go to the Brāhmaṇas and elders and deliver a decree to the Brāhmaṇas and elders to stop for a moment, and now the king will quickly arrive and pay homage to the ascetic Kāśyapa as you do.

source_sentence: 彼眾奉命已止不進。」
translation: After they obeyed the order, they stopped and didn't advance."

source_sentence: 時正句王嚴整車駕出於宮城，與婆羅門及長者眾同共往詣尸利沙林鹿野之園。
translation: The king of the true sayings then left the palace in his chariot in full regalia and went with the Brāhmaṇas and elders to the Deer Preserve in the Śrīsapura forest.

source_sentence: 王心憍慢，所乘車駕至不通處，方乃下車徒步而進，行至園中尊者住處。
translation: Being proud of himself, the king got off his chariot and proceeded on foot only after it reached an impassable place.

source_sentence: 時正句王與婆羅門長者眾，等見於尊者童子迦葉，初未信重不甚恭肅。
translation: The king of the right phrase and a group of Brāhmaṇa elders met the Venerable Kāśyapa, a young boy whom they hadn't yet trusted and didn't take very seriously.

source_sentence: 王與尊者互伸問訊退坐一面，時婆羅門長者眾等，見王如是亦微鄭重，咸共相與圍繞而住。
translation: When the king and the Venerable extended greetings to each other and withdrew to sit at one side, the Brahman elders and others who saw the king like that also showed slight respect, so they all joined together and stayed around him.

source_sentence: 爾時，大王即伸問言：「尊者迦葉！
translation: At that point, the king then extended a question, saying, "Venerable Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 當聽我語。
translation: "Listen to my words.

source_sentence: 如我意者，無有來世復無有人亦無化生。
translation: 'As I wish, there's no future life, and there's neither person nor birth by transformation.

source_sentence: 我意如是，尊者云何？」
translation: Is that what I want, Bhagavān?"

source_sentence: 迦葉答言：「王若樂聞如是正義，先當誠心諦信而住。」
translation: Kāśyapa answered, "If the king is pleased to hear such correct teaching, he must first abide in sincere faith with his heart."

source_sentence: 王即報言：「唯然受教。」
translation: The king then replied, "Only so, I'll accept your teaching."

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉告大王言：「王見日月為有無耶？
translation: It was then that Kāśyapa addressed the king, "Does the king see the sun and moon as being alive or not?

source_sentence: 此世來世於理顯然，不委大王，當云何見當云何聞？」
translation: In this world and the next, the principle is clear, so why don't you entrust it to the great king, and how will you see and hear it?"

source_sentence: 王言：「迦葉！
translation: The king said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 若此日月此世來世，如我見聞同於尊者。」
translation: If the sun and moon exist in this world or the next, as I've seen and heard, they'll be the same as the venerable."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「如王所見，日月為有，來世亦然。
translation: Kāśyapa then replied, "As the king has seen, the sun and moon are existent, and so will be the future world.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 不應執如前見。」
translation: You shouldn't hold to the view as before."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「大王！
translation: Kāśyapa again said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 如沙門婆羅門乃至應供、世間解等，須知定有若因若果此世來世，以智自通如實了知。
translation: "For example, ascetics and priests, even those who are worthy of offerings and worldly understanding, should know that there must be both cause and effect in this and the next life, and they should accurately comprehend them with their own knowledge.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 不應如前執於斷見。」
translation: You shouldn't hold to a nihilistic view as before."

source_sentence: 爾時，大王迷執未省，謂迦葉言：「汝今云何作如是言？
translation: At the time, the king, still deluded in his attachment, said to Kāśyapa, "Now, why are you saying this?

source_sentence: 如我意者實無來世，而汝迦葉勿復強言。」
translation: As I intend, there really is no afterlife, so you Kāśyapa mustn't insist."

source_sentence: 復次，迦葉報大王言：「即今王身為有無耶？
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa told the great king, "Does the king's body now exist or not?

source_sentence: 如王此身以為有者，云何斷見言無來世？
translation: If the king thinks this body exists, how does he stop seeing and say there's no future life?

source_sentence: 當以何喻證於此理？」
translation: What metaphor will be used to realize this principle?"

source_sentence: 大王答言：「尊者迦葉！
translation: The king replied, "Venerable Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我今有喻證於此理，今身是有來世即無。」
translation: Now, I have a parable that proves this principle, 'This body exists, and the next life will be nonexistent.'"

source_sentence: 王言：「迦葉！
translation: The king said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 如我親屬或染疾病，纏綿既久將趣命終，我時往彼問訊告言：『汝病深重定知不可，若是殞歿切有相囑。』
translation: Suppose a relative of mine is sick and is about to die after a long illness, and I go to them, inquire, and tell them, 'You must know that your illness is serious and that you can't die; if you die, you must give instructions.'

source_sentence: 我聞沙門及婆羅門先有是言：『若人破戒造惡業者，命終之後墮於地獄。』
translation: I heard that ascetics and priests first said, 'If someone breaks the precepts and does bad actions, they'll fall into hell when their life ends.'

source_sentence: 如沙門婆羅門等言若真實，汝等親屬命終之後必墮地獄。
translation: If what the ascetics and priests said is true, your relatives will surely fall into hell after their lives end.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 汝諸親屬破戒造罪，以此當知定落惡趣。
translation: 'Your relatives have broken the precepts and committed sins, and you should know that this will surely land you in a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 若在惡趣當遣使來，或復自來告語於我：『今在地獄極受苦楚。』
translation: If you're in a bad destiny, you'll send a messenger, or you might come yourself and tell me, 'Now I'm in hell and will experience extreme pain.'

source_sentence: 汝若來報我必往救。
translation: If you come in retaliation, I'll go to save you.

source_sentence: 但有去人曾無來者。
translation: But there's no one who's gone who's ever come.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 如我之意，以此為喻，定無來世。」
translation: As I intended, this is a metaphor that will surely have no future life."

source_sentence: 迦葉報言：「大王！
translation: Kāśyapa replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 此喻雖陳，未為正說。
translation: Although this metaphor is presented, it's not yet properly explained.

source_sentence: 我今問王，譬如有人犯於王法，為巡守者執之，將至王所而白王言：『是人違犯如是之罪不敢隱覆。』
translation: Now, I'd like to ask the king, 'Suppose a person violates the king's law and a watchman takes them into his custody and comes to the king and tells him, 'That person has violated such a sin and doesn't dare to cover it up.'

source_sentence: 王聞所奏即勅有司，令將罪人反縛兩手牢固其身，駈往四衢多人聚處，鳴鼓告示：『今此罪人犯如是法。』
translation: When the king heard what he had told him, he ordered a servant to take the offender, bind his hands together and secure his body, and send him out into the four quadrants where many people were gathered, sounding a drum and announcing, 'Now, this offender has violated this kind of law.'

source_sentence: 東西南北遍於城內咸使聞知，後將出城，依法處斷。
translation: They were heard by people all over the city, both east and west, north and south, and then they were to leave the city and punish him according to the law.

source_sentence: 有司奉命，即將罪人，反縛兩手牢固其身，駈往四衢多人聚處，鳴鼓告示：『今此罪人犯如是法。』
translation: A superior officer was instructed to take the offender, bind his hands behind his back and secure his body, and send him to the four thoroughfares where many people were gathered, sounding a drum and announcing, 'Now, this offender has violated this law.'

source_sentence: 東西南北遍於城內，准王宣命處處告示，仕庶知已駈領出城依法處斷。
translation: He was sent east, west, north, and south throughout the city in response to the king's order to announce it everywhere, and when the common people knew it, they led him out of the city to be punished according to the law.

source_sentence: 如此罪人，臨赴法時告監守言：『願垂哀愍放我少時，暫至家中辭別親屬。』
translation: When such a criminal is about to go to justice, he tells the guardian, 'Please have mercy on me and let me go home for a short time to say goodbye to my family.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 彼監守人，還敢暫放令歸家不？」
translation: Would he dare to release the order to return home for a while?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不也。
translation: The king said, "No.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 設使此人種種哀切，彼監守人亦不敢放。
translation: Even if this person is so concerned, the guard won't dare to release him.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 王法所錄無容暫赦。」
translation: There's no room for temporary pardon when it comes to what the king's laws record."

source_sentence: 尊者迦葉復言：「大王！
translation: Venerable Kāśyapa then replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 王諸親屬以罪業故，命終之後墮地獄中，以其罪業常受苦楚。
translation: The king's relatives fall into hell after their lives end because of their misdeeds, and they are constantly subjected to suffering because of their misdeeds.

source_sentence: 是諸罪人告其獄卒，乞暫相放還歸人間，至於王所求王救苦。
translation: Those sinners tell their jailers to beg them to be released temporarily and return to the human realm, and they go to the king to ask him to save them from their suffering.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: "Great king!

source_sentence: 是地獄卒還肯放不？」
translation: Is the hell-keeper still willing to release them?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不也。」
translation: The king said, "No."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「大王！
translation: Kāśyapa then replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 義同世間無暫放理。
translation: Their meaning is the same as the world's principle of no temporary release.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 勿將此喻同於來世，執斷見者非為正理。
translation: Don't equate this metaphor with the future life, for those who hold to a view of elimination aren't following the correct principle.

source_sentence: 是故當知，有今世者定有來世，乃至沙門婆羅門、應供、世間解，以智自通，了知真實，不應更執如前之見。」
translation: Therefore, you should know that there's a present world that will certainly be a future world, even if ascetics, priests, and worldly practitioners understand it for themselves with knowledge and comprehend its reality, so they shouldn't further cling to views like the previous ones."

source_sentence: 王復報言：「尊者迦葉！
translation: The king again replied, "Venerable Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 斯言非當我意未允，不應更言實有後世。」
translation: This is not something I would say if my intentions were impermissible; I shouldn't say there's really an afterlife."

source_sentence: 復次，迦葉報大王言：「王意如是，勿更有喻可為證耶？」
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa reported to the great king, "Thus does the king think, isn't there another metaphor that can prove it?"

source_sentence: 王言：「迦葉！
translation: The king said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我今更有親屬之喻可以為證。
translation: Now, I have another parable of a relative to testify to that.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 如我親屬染於重病，將其命斷還當付囑，告病人言：『我聞沙門及婆羅門常作是說：「若人持戒修諸善法，或有惠施三輪清淨，見他殊勝不生嫉意，是人命盡生於天界。」
translation: Suppose I have a relative who's seriously ill and I tell him to give instructions when his life is cut short, saying, 'I've heard that ascetics and priests often say, "If a person observes precepts and cultivates good qualities, or if they give generosity and purify the three wheels, and if they see the excellence of others and don't become jealous, that person's life will end and he'll be born in the heavenly realm."

source_sentence: 若彼沙門及婆羅門所言誠實，汝之命終必生天界。
translation: If what those ascetics and priests say is true, you'll surely be born in the heavenly realm when your life ends.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我觀於汝常具戒品及修善法，三輪清淨而行惠施，仍於他勝不生嫉意，以此當知定生天界。
translation: 'I've observed that you always possess the qualities of morality and cultivate good qualities, that your three wheels are purified, and that you give generosity, and that you don't become jealous of the superiority of others, so I know you'll surely be born in the heavenly realm.

source_sentence: 若得生天當遣使來，或復自來用報於我：「即今已得生於某天，受於快樂。」』
translation: If you are allowed to be born in a heaven, you'll send an envoy, or you might come yourself and tell me, 'Now I've been born in a certain heaven and will enjoy its pleasures.'

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我諸親屬若實生天必來相報，云何親屬但見終歿無來報者？
translation: "If my relatives were actually born in heaven, they would surely come to me in retribution, so why do they only see their final death and not come to me in retribution?

source_sentence: 以此當知，定無來世。」
translation: You should know from this that there certainly won't be an afterlife."

source_sentence: 迦葉告大王言：「我今亦欲重說譬喻，令王得見實有來世。
translation: Kāśyapa told the king, "Now, I also want to explain the parable again so that the king can see that there really is an afterlife.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 譬如穢坑臭不可近，時有一人悞墮其中，臭穢難堪方便得出；身既出已即用諸香煮水沐浴，復以塗香以塗其身，身既香潔，又以殊妙迦尸迦衣及珍寶花鬘莊嚴其身，住於家中受其快樂。
translation: It's like a man who falls into a filthy pit that smells too bad to approach, and he finds it difficult to escape from the stench. After emerging, he then washes his body with water boiled with incense, rubs his body with fragrant oil, cleanses it with fragrance, adorns it with exquisite Kāśyika robes and precious flower garlands, and lives in his home to enjoy it.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 如是之人還復樂入前穢坑不？」
translation: Would such a person still happily enter the former filthy pit?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不也。
translation: The king said, "No.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 彼穢惡坑人非所樂。」
translation: That filthy pit is not pleasant for people."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「大王！
translation: Kāśyapa again said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 彼人生天亦復如是，既得生天，豈復更思還來人間？
translation: "So it is with those who are born in heaven. Once they've been born in heaven, how could they ever think of returning to the human realm?

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: "Again, my lord!

source_sentence: 人間百年等忉利天是一晝夜。
translation: A hundred years among humans and so forth in the Heaven of Truth is one day and one night.

source_sentence: 大王親屬修諸善法，既生天界晝夜受樂，豈復更思還來報王，我生天界晝夜受樂。
translation: After cultivating the good qualities of your relatives, you were born in the heavenly realm and experience pleasure by day and night, so why would you think of returning to the king and rewarding him with my birth in the heavenly realm and experience pleasure by day and night?

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 汝與天人壽命長短為相等不？」
translation: Are you equal to gods and humans in terms of length of life?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不也。
translation: The king said, "No.

source_sentence: 迦葉！」
translation: Kāśyapa!"

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「大王！
translation: Kāśyapa again said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 天界人界本自懸隔，不應如愚顒望相報，然後方可信有後世。
translation: The heavenly realm and the human realm are inherently separated, and it shouldn't be like a foolish expectation of retribution before one can believe in an afterlife.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 彼沙門婆羅門、應供、世間解，乃至後世須知實有，可以自智如實了知，不應更作無後世見。」
translation: Those ascetics, priests, worshipers, and worldly-understanders who need to know about their true existence in the afterlife can accurately comprehend it on their own, and they shouldn't furthermore come to see that there's no afterlife."

source_sentence: 王報迦葉：「如尊者言亦未可信。
translation: The king reported to Kāśyapa, "Even if it's as the venerable says, it's not plausible.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 所云人間百年等忉利天為一晝夜，有何人來告語於汝，人間百年等忉利天為一晝夜？」
translation: They say that a hundred years among humans is one day and night in the Heaven of Truth, but who has come to tell you that a hundred years among humans is one day and night in the Heaven of Truth?"

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「如王所見喻生盲人。
translation: Kāśyapa then replied, "As the king sees it, the metaphor arises of blindness.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 生盲之人本自不見青黃赤白、細妙麤惡長短色相，便作是言：『本無如是青黃赤白、細妙麤惡長短色相。』
translation: A person who's blind doesn't see the marks of blue, yellow, red, white, subtle, coarse, and negative forms, long and short, and then says, 'Such marks of blue, yellow, red, white, subtle, coarse, and negative forms, long and short, don't exist.'

source_sentence: 又言：『我亦不知我亦不見。』
translation: And he says, 'I don't know and I don't see them.'

source_sentence: 是生盲人以己不見，便乃執云本無如是青黃赤白乃至長短色相。
translation: Because he doesn't see it, this blind man then assumes that there's nothing like this in the past, whether it's blue, yellow, red, white, or even long and short in form.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 勿同生盲執無色相。」
translation: Don't be born blind, clinging to the mark of formlessness."

source_sentence: 王言：「迦葉！
translation: The king said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 如我意者，而彼天界若實有者，我即言有，既實本無，云何令我說云實有？」
translation: If that heavenly realm really existed, as I think, I would say it does; since it really doesn't exist, why would I be allowed to say that it does exist?"

source_sentence: 復言：「迦葉！
translation: Again, he said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝非善人。
translation: "You're not a good person.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我見本正，云何喻我同彼生盲？
translation: If my view is originally correct, why is it that I'm metaphorically born blind like them?

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝前所說生天等事，我實不信，若信此言，如食毒藥如刃臨身，如上山墜身自害其命。
translation: I really don't believe what you said about being born in heaven, and if I believed that, it would be like eating poison, like a blade coming near your body, or like falling down from a mountain and harming your own life.

source_sentence: 如是諸惡我皆遠離。」
translation: Such are the evils I've avoided."

source_sentence: 復次，迦葉報大王言：「我念往昔有婆羅門，家中巨富又乃耆年，唯有一子年纔十六，母即喪亡。
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa reported to the great king, "I think about a time when a brāhmaṇa was rich and elderly and had only one son who was just 16 years old when his mother died.

source_sentence: 彼婆羅門不能鰥獨遂再婚娶，未久之間妻乃有姙，妻未生產，其婆羅門尋亦命終。
translation: That brāhmaṇa couldn't widow widowers and so remarried, and before long his wife was pregnant and she hadn't yet given birth, the brāhmaṇa's life also ended.

source_sentence: 於是其子白繼母言：『家中財物金銀珍寶，乃至一切受用之具悉屬於我，更無別人分我財物。』
translation: His son then said to his stepmother, 'My household goods, gold, silver, and jewelry, and all the things that I enjoy belong to me, and no one else will share my possessions.'

source_sentence: 時彼繼母聞子語已，即告子言：『我今所懷汝父遺體，待其長育與汝均分。』
translation: After hearing what his stepmother said, she told him, 'Now, I'm carrying your father's remains, and I'll share them with you when he grows up.'

source_sentence: 其子時復再言其事，母起思念：『此子年幼情性癡騃，雖與深言未能分曉。』
translation: The son then spoke again about it, and the mother thought, 'This son is young and foolish in nature; even though I've spoken to him deeply, I can't understand it.'

source_sentence: 又以貪惜欲疾娩身，多設方便求於速產，日月未滿返損其孕。
translation: She also wanted to give birth quickly because of her desire, and she made many precautions to have a quick delivery, but before the days and months were up, she would lose her pregnancy.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 彼之女人以貪嫉故返損其孕，大王！
translation: That woman, out of desire and jealousy, will return to impair her pregnancy, Great King!

source_sentence: 今者以愚癡故起於斷見。」
translation: Now, out of folly, I've come to a view of elimination."

source_sentence: 王復報言：「迦葉尊者！
translation: The king again replied, "Venerable Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 莫如前言。
translation: It's not like the previous saying.

source_sentence: 持戒修善及行惠施，命終之後得生天上，壽命長遠常處快樂。
translation: "Observing precepts and cultivating goodness and practicing generosity will get you born up in heaven after your life ends, and your life will be long and permanent and happy.

source_sentence: 我實不信。
translation: I really don't believe it.

source_sentence: 我今若信迦葉之語，是食毒藥是受刀劒，是墜高山自害其命。
translation: If I believe Kāśyapa's words now, it's eating poison, accepting a sword, and falling off a high mountain that will kill me.

source_sentence: 云何，迦葉！
translation: What is it, Kāśyapa?

source_sentence: 堅作是語？
translation: Is this a firm statement?

source_sentence: 如我之意，定無有人，無有後世亦無化生。」
translation: According to my thinking, there certainly is no person, no afterlife, and no birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 復次，迦葉告大王言：「莫復有喻證於斯事？」
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa told the great king, "Is there another metaphor that proves this?"

source_sentence: 王言：「迦葉！
translation: The king said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我復有喻證於斯事，知無有人無有後世亦無化生。
translation: "Again, I have a parable that realizes this, knowing that there's no person, no afterlife, and no birth by transformation.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 如我親屬或染重病，我即往彼安慰問訊，命未斷者還與我語說其苦惱，及命終已無有與我說苦惱者。
translation: Suppose I go to a relative who's seriously ill and asks for comfort, and someone whose life hasn't ended speaks to me about their suffering and distress, but no one speaks to me about their suffering and distress after their life ends.

source_sentence: 以此可知，定無後世亦無化生。」
translation: This shows that there's certainly no afterlife and no birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 迦葉告言：「我念往昔有一聚落，其中人民不識螺相，亦復未曾聞其螺聲。
translation: Kāśyapa told him, "I think about a time in the past when there was a village whose people didn't know the shape of a conch and had never heard its sound.

source_sentence: 忽有一人從外而來，到彼聚落而便止住，是人常持一螺以為功業，每日執螺詣於聖像鳴螺供養，供養已訖復還住處。
translation: Suddenly, a man came from the outside and stopped at that village. That man always carried a conch for merit, and every day he carried it to an image of a sage and fired it in offerings.

source_sentence: 時聚落中一切人民，忽聞螺聲咸悉驚恠，互相謂曰：『此是何聲？
translation: When all the people in the village suddenly heard the sound of the conch, they were all startled and said to each other, 'What's that sound?'

source_sentence: 我等眾人本所不聞。』
translation: We people hadn't heard of it.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 時聚落中一切人眾共往螺處，問彼螺言：『爾從何來可依實答，若不言實我當破汝，螺知我意速說其由。』
translation: All the people in the village then went to the conch and asked it, 'Where did you come from? Can you answer according to the truth? If you don't tell the truth, I will refute you. The conch knows my intention and will quickly explain the reason.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 彼人民眾，於其螺相及與螺聲，本所不見本所不聞，欲使其螺共為問答，螺既無情豈能言答？
translation: "That multitude of people wanting to get a conch to answer their questions about the conch's features and its sound, which they haven't seen or heard, but since the conch is insentient, how could it say anything in reply?

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 亦如大王！
translation: Just like the great king!

source_sentence: 與命終人欲共言論，人既命盡豈能再言。
translation: They want to speak together with someone whose life has ended, but after a person's life has ended, how could they say that again?

source_sentence: 大王不應執如是見，謂無有人及無後世亦無化生。」
translation: Great king, you shouldn't hold to the view that there's no person, no afterlife, and no birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「有沙門婆羅門具天眼者，以淨天眼悉見於人死此生彼，受身好惡端正醜陋，或得生天或墮惡趣。
translation: Kāśyapa then said, "There are ascetics and priests with the divine eye who, with the pure divine eye, can see that a person is born here or there after death, has a good or bad body and an ugly or fine body, and is either born in heaven or falls into a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 如是等事皆可為證，不應更言無有後世亦無化生。」
translation: Such things can be seen as proof, so it shouldn't be further stated that there's no afterlife and no birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 王言：「迦葉！
translation: The king said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 雖說此喻我意未允。
translation: Although I've explained this metaphor, I don't think it's appropriate.

source_sentence: 如我之見，定無有人亦無化生及無後世。」
translation: As I see it, there's certainly no person, no birth in the afterlife, and no birth in the afterlife."

source_sentence: 復次，迦葉告大王言：「若如是者，復有何喻可證無人亦無後世及無化生？」
translation: Furthermore, Kāśyapa told the king, "If that's the case, what other metaphor is there to confirm that there's no person, no afterlife, and no birth by transformation?"

source_sentence: 王言：「尊者！
translation: The king said, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 譬如官吏執法理人，及其臨莅自違條制，後被彈奏，王遂具知，乃勅法司將犯罪人依法斷理。
translation: Suppose a government official who administers the Dharma deals with a person who violates the rules and regulations when he comes into office and is subsequently reprimanded, and the king then becomes fully aware of it and orders the Dharma division to cut off the offender in accordance with the law.

source_sentence: 王復令言：『彼犯罪人可縛雙手，將赴法處而苦治之，以繩繫縛秤輕重，割皮削肉懸置異處。』
translation: The king then ordered them to say, 'That offender may have his hands bound, be taken to a place of justice, and be subjected to painful treatment, have them tied with a rope to measure their weight, have their skin cut off, and be hung up in a different place.'

source_sentence: 是人命在知其痛苦，若命已斷自無聲息。
translation: That person knows their pain while their life lasts, and if their life is cut short, they won't make a sound.

source_sentence: 又彼罪人命末斷時身即柔軟，命既斷已其身殭硬，至於輕重死活不同。
translation: That sinner's body is tender when his life is last cut, but his body is rigid after his life is cut, and his lightness and severity are different in death and life.

source_sentence: 尊者！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我以此知定無來世，亦無有人復無化生。」
translation: I thus know that there will surely be no future life, and no one will be born again without transformation."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「大王！
translation: Kāśyapa then replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 於意云何？
translation: What do you think?

source_sentence: 譬如鐵丸亦有輕重軟硬之異，其鐵熱時體輕而軟，其鐵冷後體重而硬。
translation: It's like an iron ball that's light and heavy, soft and hard; when it's hot, its body is light and soft, but when it's cold, its body is heavy and hard.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 有情無情皆稟四大，以彼四大有其合散，是有軟硬冷熱之異，勿將此理比於後世及化生等。
translation: All sentient and insentient beings are endowed with the four elements, and because those four elements have their merges and distances, there's a difference between soft and hard, cold and hot.

source_sentence: 大王須知，實有彼沙門婆羅門或具天眼者，見於眾生死此生彼，乃至端正醜陋，或生天上或墮惡趣，悉可證知，實有來世及化生等。」
translation: Great king, you should know that there really are ascetics, priests, or those with the divine eye who see that sentient beings die here and there, are born here and there, are correct and ugly, and are either born in heaven or fall into a bad destiny, and they can all realize that there really is an afterlife and birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 王言：「尊者！
translation: The king said, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 如汝所言未為誠信。
translation: As you say, you don't really believe it.

source_sentence: 我之意者，實無有人無有後世亦無化生。」
translation: My intention is that there's really no person, no afterlife, and no birth by transformation."

source_sentence: 大正句王經卷上
translation: Dazheng juewang jing, vol. 1
